dt: {bc}to take or drink in swallows or gulps
{bc}to take food and especially liquid food into the mouth a little at a time

et: Middle English {it}suppen{/it}, from Old English {it}sūpan, suppan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}sūfan{/it} to drink, sip, Old English {it}sopp{/it} sop
shortdef: to take or drink in swallows or gulps
to take food and especially liquid food into the mouth a little at a time

et: Middle English {it}soupen, suppen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}super{/it}, from {it}supe{/it} sop, soup {ma}{mat|soup|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make one's supper —used with on or off
